interestingcomments.content: Except for, of course, the light loss of converters.
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: Except for, of course, the light loss of converters.

interestingcomments.content: No, I use the Colorchecker to make a profile. I have a whole series by now of different types of light. If I cannot get the skintone just so I move over to C1. The problem with skin is that it is multilayered, each layer has its own IR character, and it is not uniform in colour. However, when we look at a person our brain will record a more or less uniform colour. The camera records the colours as they are objectively, hence the unnatural look. Add the IR issue and you have your problem.
